ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course for anyone with a strong interest in American Politics, particularly if they enjoy theory-oriented classes and seminar discussions.
American Politics is a concise introduction to the ideas of the field. I would recommend it to become acquainted with the field, but be warned that the reading material is often dry.

I would definitely only recommend this course to students outside of the political science program if they are prepared to do a lot of reading. I was definitely shocked by the amount of reading required for this course (given that I am not accustomed to the PhD program). I definitely think I benefited from a background in history and historical research from my undergrad. If someone is prepared for the work, I would recommend this class to those who want some insight into how to look at and discuss politics at a theoretical level. I loved this course, but I do not know if many public health students would find it as useful as I feel like I did. I also loved that there was no final exam!!
Yes, if they have some interest in American Politics.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: As I want to work in policy, and probably American public policy (or something closely related), this course was a very good choice for me.
I gained a greater appreciation of the questions, debates and ideas of American Politics.
